dt: {bc}a part of a sail taken in or let out in regulating size

et: Middle English {it}riff{/it}, from Old Norse {it}rif{/it}; probably akin to Old Norse {it}rīfa{/it} to rend {ma}{mat|rive|}{/ma}
shortdef: a part of a sail taken in or let out in regulating size
reduction in sail area by reefing

dt: {bc}to reduce the area of (a sail) by rolling or folding a portion
{bc}to lower or bring inboard (a spar) wholly or partially
{bc}to reduce a sail by taking in a reef

shortdef: to reduce the area of (a sail) by rolling or folding a portion
to lower or bring inboard (a spar) wholly or partially
to reduce a sail by taking in a reef

dt: {bc}a chain of rocks or coral or a ridge of sand at or near the surface of water {dx}compare {dxt|atoll||}, {dxt|barrier reef||}{/dx}

et: Dutch {it}rif{/it}, from Middle Dutch, from Old Norse, literally rib; akin to Old English {it}ribb{/it} rib {ma}{mat|rib|}{/ma}
shortdef: a chain of rocks or coral or a ridge of sand at or near the surface of water

dt: {bc}a square knot used in reefing a sail

shortdef: a square knot used in reefing a sail

dt: {bc}a coral reef roughly parallel to a shore and separated from it usually by a lagoon

shortdef: a coral reef roughly parallel to a shore and separated from it usually by a lagoon

dt: {bc}a slender-bodied, nocturnal {d_link|requiem shark|requiem shark} ({it}Triaenodon obesus{/it}) chiefly of tropical seas that has dorsal and tail fins tipped with white, that may reach a length of seven feet (2.1 meters) but is usually shorter, that tends to be found near coral reefs, and that typically rests on the sea bottom or in underwater caves

dt.t: Most sharks have to keep moving to breathe, but the nocturnal {wi}whitetip reef shark{/wi} can pump water over its gills and rest for hours during the day.
Occasionally a {wi}white-tip reef shark{/wi} would glide by, and when I found one resting on the sand, I was able to settle almost alongside it.

shortdef: a slender-bodied, nocturnal requiem shark (Triaenodon obesus) chiefly of tropical seas that has dorsal and tail fins tipped with white, that may reach a length of seven feet (2.1 meters) but is usually shorter, that tends to be found near coral reefs, and that typically rests on the sea bottom or in underwater caves —called also whitetip shark

dt: area of coral reefs surrounding Saint Croix in the Virgin Islands of the U.S.

shortdef: area of coral reefs surrounding Saint Croix in the Virgin Islands of the U.S.

dt: long reef of rocks in the English Channel at the mouth of the Orne River in northwestern France

shortdef: long reef of rocks in the English Channel at the mouth of the Orne River in northwestern France

dt: area in south central Utah containing archaeological remains, petrified forests, and unusual erosion formations

shortdef: area in south central Utah containing archaeological remains, petrified forests, and unusual erosion formations

dt: coral reef 1250 miles (2012 kilometers) long in the Coral Sea off the northeast coast of Queensland, Australia
Most of the Great Barrier Reef is designated a marine park.

shortdef: coral reef 1250 miles (2012 kilometers) long in the Coral Sea off the northeast coast of Queensland, Australia
